howto.title: Use this checklist as a guide
howto.why: This app is designed to help homeowners spot common issues before they become expensive problems.
howto.look: Work through items at your own pace. You can stop and resume anytime.
howto.note: This is educational, not a substitute for a professional inspection.

spring.title: Inspect exterior hose bibs
spring.why: Freeze damage often shows up when water pressure is restored.
spring.look: Leaks at the valve, cracked fittings, water stains on siding or foundation.
spring.note: Older homes often lack frost-free hose bibs.

spring.title: Check interior shutoff valves
spring.why: Failed valves leak once exterior lines are pressurized.
spring.look: Drips, corrosion, mineral buildup, stiff operation.
spring.note: Gate valves commonly fail with age.

spring.title: Inspect foundation for frost movement
spring.why: Freeze/thaw cycles can cause seasonal shifting.
spring.look: New cracks, widening gaps, displaced masonry.
spring.note: Horizontal cracks deserve further evaluation.

spring.title: Verify positive grading away from foundation
spring.why: Snowmelt water against the foundation leads to intrusion.
spring.look: Soil sloping toward the house, settled backfill.
spring.note: Minimum recommended slope is 6 inches over 10 feet.

spring.title: Check downspouts and extensions
spring.why: Roof runoff must discharge away from the structure.
spring.look: Missing extensions, crushed pipes, disconnected joints.
spring.note: Splash blocks are often inadequate alone.

spring.title: Inspect roof surface from ground
spring.why: Winter damage can compromise roofing materials.
spring.look: Missing shingles, lifted edges, exposed fasteners.
spring.note: Binoculars are sufficient â€” no roof access needed.

spring.title: Check roof flashing areas
spring.why: Flashing failures cause most roof leaks.
spring.look: Bent metal, sealant gaps, rust at penetrations.
spring.note: Chimney flashing is a frequent failure point.

spring.title: Inspect attic for moisture evidence
spring.why: Ice dams and condensation leave clues behind.
spring.note: Moisture often indicates air leakage, not just insulation issues.

spring.title: Confirm attic ventilation paths
spring.why: Blocked ventilation traps moisture.
spring.look: Insulation covering soffit vents, blocked baffles.
spring.note: Improper venting contributes to ice dam formation.

spring.title: Check exterior siding and trim
spring.why: Winter moisture exposes hidden decay.
spring.look: Soft wood, peeling paint, open joints.
spring.note: South and west elevations often show the most wear.

spring.title: Inspect window and door seals
spring.why: Failed seals allow water and air intrusion.
spring.note: Re-caulking is maintenance, not a defect.

spring.title: Test GFCI outlets (interior & exterior)
spring.why: GFCIs protect against shock in wet locations.
spring.note: Exterior outlets frequently fail over winter.

spring.title: Inspect exterior electrical covers
spring.why: Weather exposure damages protective covers.
spring.note: In-use covers are required in wet locations.

spring.title: Examine deck ledger attachment
spring.why: Ledger failure can cause deck collapse.
spring.note: Improper ledger attachment is common in older decks.

spring.title: Check deck walking surface
spring.why: Freeze/thaw accelerates wood deterioration.
spring.note: Probe suspicious areas with light pressure.

spring.title: Inspect deck stairs and handrails
spring.why: Most deck injuries occur on stairs.
spring.note: Graspable handrails are often missing.

spring.title: Inspect foundation vents (if present)
spring.why: Open vents affect moisture and energy performance.
spring.look: Damage, missing covers, improper seasonal position.
spring.note: Many vents should remain closed year-round.

spring.title: Inspect sump pump operation
spring.why: Spring snowmelt stresses drainage systems.
spring.look: Proper discharge, abnormal noise, failure to run.
spring.note: Test by adding water, not lifting the float.

spring.title: Check sump discharge location
spring.why: Improper discharge recirculates water back to foundation.
spring.look: Short discharge, frozen lines, crushed piping.
spring.note: Discharge should extend well away from the home.

spring.title: Inspect basement and crawlspace floors
spring.why: Seepage often appears during spring thaw.
spring.note: White powder indicates chronic moisture.

spring.title: Inspect interior ceilings and walls
spring.why: Winter roof leaks may show up late.
spring.note: Water often travels before becoming visible.

spring.title: Test smoke alarms
spring.why: Winter power outages can disable alarms.
spring.note: Replace units older than 10 years.

spring.title: Test carbon monoxide alarms
spring.why: Combustion appliances run heavily in winter.
spring.note: Required outside sleeping areas.

spring.title: Inspect furnace exhaust venting
spring.why: Snow and ice can block vents.
spring.note: Improper venting is a serious safety issue.

spring.title: Inspect water heater area
spring.why: Leaks often go unnoticed during winter.
spring.note: Pan and drain recommended where leakage could cause damage.

spring.title: Check floor drains
spring.why: Traps dry out over winter.
spring.note: Pour water to refill traps.

spring.title: Inspect driveway and walkways
spring.why: Frost heave creates trip hazards.
spring.note: Liability risk increases with uneven surfaces.

spring.title: Inspect exterior steps and landings
spring.why: Freeze damage compromises stability.
spring.note: Handrails required for multiple risers.

spring.title: Inspect chimney exterior
spring.why: Masonry absorbs water and deteriorates.
spring.note: Crown damage accelerates failure.

spring.title: Walk the property perimeter
spring.why: Seasonal changes reveal new conditions.
spring.note: This often catches issues missed individually.

summer.title: Check deck attachments
summer.why: Deck ledger failures are a leading cause of deck collapses.
summer.note: Improper ledger attachment is common in older decks.

fall.title: Shut down exterior water lines
fall.why: Water left in lines can freeze and cause hidden damage.
fall.look: Proper shutoff, drained lines, capped hose bibs.
fall.note: Compressed air may be required in some systems.

winter.title: Monitor attic insulation
winter.why: Poor insulation contributes to ice dams and heat loss.
winter.look: Compressed insulation, air gaps, moisture staining.
winter.note: Ice dams often indicate air leakage, not just insulation depth.

safety.title: Test smoke and CO alarms
safety.look: Expired units, missing alarms, weak sound.
